name: uncommon
content:
uncommon adjective
(NOT FREQUENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 not seen, happening, or experienced often: Accidents due to failure of safety equipment are uncommon nowadays. It's not uncommon for people to become ill when they travel.

[ not gradable ] not seen, happening, or experienced often: It’s not uncommon for someone to change jobs several times.
uncommon adjective
(UNUSUALLY LARGE)
(esp. of a human quality) unusually large in amount or degree: She’s a woman of uncommon kindness. uncommonly adverb us
